alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Typhoon Watch issued October 10 at 9:37PM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: ...BOLAVEN CONTINUING NORTHWEST INTO THE PHILIPPINE SEA AFTER PASSING BETWEEN ROTA AND TINIAN... .NEW INFORMATION... Bolaven has made its closest point of approach to Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan and will continue to push northwest away from those islands. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides important information and recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas. .Watches/Warnings... A Typhoon Warning continues for Rota, Tinian and Saipan. A Tropical Storm Warning and a Typhoon Watch continues for Guam. A Flash Flood Watch is in effect for all of Guam and the Northern Marianas. Please listen closely for any Flood Warnings that might be in effect for your area. Please check the latest public and marine forecasts for detailed information about additional hazards. .STORM INFORMATION... At 7 PM ChST, the center of Typhoon Bolaven (15W) was located near LATITUDE 14.8N and LONGITUDE 145.4E. This was about 35 miles south- west of Tinian and 35 miles northwest of Rota. Storm motion was northwest at 14 mph. Storm intensity was 80 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... Bolaven made its passage through the Marianas between Rota and Tinian this evening. Bolaven`s maximum wind speed remains at 80 mph. Bolaven will continue to push off to the northwest of the Marianas overnight with wind decreasing over Guam and the CNMI. Heavy to torrential rainfall has fallen over Rota and Guam. Heavy rainfall is expected and flash flooding remains possible for Guam and the CNMI through tonight. .PRECAUTIONARY/SAFETY ACTIONS... Even though Bolaven is moving away from Guam and the CNMI, dangerous conditions persist and warnings continue. Remain in shelter until officials have given the all-clear. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast. && .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan, Guam around 3 AM ChST, or sooner if conditions warrant. ...Tropical Storm Warning remains in effect... ...Typhoon Watch remains in effect... ...PRECAUTIONARY/SAFETY ACTIONS... Even though Bolaven is moving away from Guam, dangerous conditions persist and the Tropical Storm Warning continues. Stay inside and only evacuate if directed to do so by local officials, or if your home is vulnerable to flooding. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast. && ...WIND INFORMATION... The threat for damaging tropical storm force winds of 39 mph or greater will continue the next few hours but will decrease early Wednesday morning. Winds will decrease Wednesday and become southwest to south 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. ...COASTAL INUNDATION AND SURF INFORMATION... The peak inundation threat has passed but minor inundation is still possible through tonight, especially during high tide around 5 AM Wednesday morning. Dangerous surf conditions with surf heights exceeding 15 feet are expected through Wednesday. Hazardous surf conditions are expected to continue through at least Thursday. ...INLAND FLOODING... A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect for the entire area. Four to six inches of rain has fallen already across much of Guam and an additional 2 to 4 inches is possible through Wednesday morning. Listen for possible flood warnings for your location, and be ready to act if flooding rains occur.
